subject: Re: Digital Voice Recorder Advice
author: psi_research
full_text:
Hi Robin,
Your phrase of "ritualized vs. random" is interesting. There are many
who believe that communication is between the conscious of the
researcher and the entity and the equipment is secondary. It's easy to
get swept up in the technology and forget there is possibly a psychic
connection going on. With that said, focusing on equipment actually
can help the researcher become receptive to establishing a
communication link. While paying attention to the equipment, we forget
about the daily distractions and minor irritations that may prevent us
from establishing contact. 

The setting up the gear we use could be considered the first part of
the "ritual". I like to clear my mind, set up equipment, mess with it
some more, then I am mentally prepare to begin what I hope will be a
successful session.

I guess "random" recording to me would be what happens in the field
during a paranormal investigation. I don't bring Box technology into a
location with the intention of possibly contacting lingering spirits
at that location but I do bring audio recorders in hopes of recording
evp's.

I find the Box works perhaps even better when I'm in a familiar place
like the room in my home that is designated for that purpose. I do
desire to have the finest Box technology that is possible but more
important is the association that seems to occur between the
researcher and the Box that is favored. Despite some of the benefits
of the new gear, the one that I seem to have a connection with is one
that requires a little more finesse to operate.  -Bill
